SMach Class Reference

State Machine class. More...

#include <SMach.hpp>

Inheritance diagram for SMach:
Collaboration diagram for SMach:

Detailed Description

The State Machine class is a lightweight, powerful mechanism for implementing state machines. SMach inherits State so that state machines can execute within state machines.

Public Member Functions

virtual bool action (void)
 Action to run this state machine (non-blocking)
 
State * current ()
 Return a pointer to the current state.
 
 Public Member Functions inherited from State
virtual const char * name ()
 Returns the name of a state.
 
virtual bool entry_action (void)
 Action called when entering state.
 
virtual State * exit_condition (State *list[])
 Checks to see if it is time to exit the state (optionally executes an exit action)
 
virtual bool transition (const char *name)
 Called when exiting to the state specified by name. More...

 Execute the top level state machine (blocking)

 Searches a state list for name.

 Checks to see if ptr is a valid state.

 Returns a pointer to an invalid state.
